meanings.definition: A projection on the end of a piece of wood for insertion into a mortise to make a joint.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully crafted the tenon to fit perfectly into the mortise.
meanings.sent2: He secured the table legs by inserting the tenon into the mortise.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the tenon of the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a tenon, fitting seamlessly into the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The tenon, like a puzzle piece, completed the wooden structure.

meanings.definition: To join by means of a tenon.
meanings.sent1: He will tenon the pieces together to create a sturdy frame.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to tenon the boards for her woodworking project.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to tenon the ropes together for his next trick.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a tenon, connecting them through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: She skillfully tenoned the parts, ensuring a strong bond.
